summary: chipotle has decided to tap into the $ 70 billion food delivery market by teaming up with an app to bring burritos straight to customers ' doors . the fast-casual chain will work with the postmates app to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities . the restaurant plans to add a nine per cent service charge - with the delivery fees for postmates beginning at $ 5 and up depending on distance and demand .

aspect: 1. Chipotle joins food delivery market with Postmates in 67 cities.
2. Chipotle rejects previous delivery offers, partners with Postmates like Uber taxis.
3. Marco Rubio, Hillary Clinton are Chipotle customers.
4. Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, Burger King also entering delivery market.
explain:
Chipotle, a popular fast-casual chain, has recently made a strategic decision to expand its business into the food delivery market.

Provide additional context/details.
To achieve this, they have partnered with the Postmates app, a well-known food delivery platform. Thanks to this collaboration, customers in 67 major cities across the United States can now order Chipotle's delicious burritos and other menu items online or through the mobile app and have them delivered straight to their doorsteps.

Analyze the implications.
This move allows Chipotle to tap into the massive $70 billion food delivery market, increasing its customer base and revenue. In addition, it enables them to better compete with other fast-casual chains that already offer delivery. Customers will enjoy the convenience of having their favorite Chipotle meals delivered to their doorstep, and Chipotle will benefit from increased sales and potentially improved customer loyalty.

Summarize the main idea.
Chipotle has joined the food delivery market by partnering with Postmates in 67 cities, allowing customers to order and receive their delicious burritos and other menu items at their doorstep and expanding the fast-casual chain's customer base and revenue.

Chipotle has decided not to collaborate with other delivery services before Postmates, and has instead partnered with Postmates to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities. This suggests that Chipotle might see Postmates as a more suitable partner for their delivery service needs, or they could be looking to explore a new partnership to reach a wider customer base.

Summarize the topic.
Summary: Chipotle has teamed up with the Postmates app to bring their burritos straight to customers' doors through a food delivery service. Beginning in 67 cities, Chipotle will charge a 9% service fee on top of the delivery fees for Postmates, which range from $5 to more depending on the distance and demand. Chipotle rejected previous delivery offers and chose to partner with Postmates similar to how Uber taxis work.
Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton, both former presidential candidates in the United States, have both reportedly mentioned Chipotle as one of their favorite restaurants.

The aspect highlights how other popular food chains such as Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King are also joining the food delivery market to cater to customers' changing preferences and increase their revenue.
